plant.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: a living thing that has leaves and roots and grows in earth, especially one that is smaller than a tree
plant.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: Don’t forget to water the plants.
plant.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: a factory or building where an industrial process happens
plant.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: heavy machinery that is used in industrial processes
plant.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: something illegal or stolen that is hidden in someone’s clothes or possessions to make them seem guilty of a crime
plant.translation[0].definitions[4].defi: someone who is put somewhere or sent somewhere secretly to find out information
plant.translation[0].note_box[0].section: Many rare plants were collected from India and China.
These plants are common in British gardens.
Many wild plants are in danger of dying out.
These butterflies feed on the flowers of several garden plants.
Exotic plants can be grown in a greenhouse.
A lot of research into medicinal plants and traditional remedies has now been carried out.
He leaves his house key under the potted plant on the porch.
The wall was covered with climbing plants.
Bean plants are easy to grow.
What should you do if your child has eaten a poisonous plant?
The plant grows to a height of about 20 inches.
A lot of plants thrive in partial shade.
The plants are flowering earlier this year.
It is not an easy plant to grow.
He could see her watering the plants in her small garden.
All but the dirtiest of rivers support some plant life.
They feed on decaying plant material.
plant.translation[0].note_box[1].section: a living thing that has leaves and roots and grows in earth, especially one that is smaller than a tree
Don’t forget to water the plants.
Plants grow towards the sun.
Botanists examined plant species from around the world.
herb
a small plant that is used to improve the taste of food, or to make medicine
Sprinkle the dish with chopped fresh herbs.
medicinal herbs  (=used as medicine)
The shop sells an interesting range of herbs and spices.
weed
a wild plant growing where it is not wanted that prevents crops or garden flowers from growing properly
She was pulling up weeds in her garden.
Herbicides can be used to prevent and control weeds.
bulb
a root shaped like a ball that grows into a flower or plant
She planted hundreds of daffodil bulbs.
shrub
a small bush with several woody stems
flowering shrubs
Rosemary is an evergreen shrub.
plant.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: to put plants or seeds in the ground to grow
plant.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: Residents have helped us plant trees.
We’ve planted tomatoes and carrots in the garden.
a hillside planted with fir trees
plant.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: to put something firmly in or on something else
plant.translation[1].definitions[1].exam: He came up to her and planted a kiss on her cheek.
She planted her feet firmly to the spot and refused to move.
plant.translation[1].definitions[2].defi: to hide stolen or illegal goods in someone’s clothes, bags, room etc in order to make them seem guilty of a crime
plant.translation[1].definitions[2].exam: She claims that the police planted the drugs on her.
plant.translation[1].definitions[3].defi: to put or send someone somewhere, especially secretly, so that they can find out information
plant.translation[1].definitions[3].exam: The police had planted undercover detectives at every entrance.
plant.translation[2].definitions[0].defi: the machinery and equipment used in an industrial process or activity
plant.translation[2].definitions[0].exam: There is a desperate need to rebuild the stock of productive plant and equipment in this country.
plant.translation[2].definitions[1].defi: a factory or building where an industrial process takes place or a product is made
plant.translation[2].definitions[1].exam: The Japanese car company plans to spend $600 million on a new engine plant.
